intro: Teucrium botrydium, commonly known as the woolly germander, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is characterized by its aromatic, fuzzy leaves and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is often found in open woodland or scrubland habitats. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. Teucrium botrydium is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
